questions.text: A 21-year-old male sustained an injury to his right thumb while skiing. He was holding onto a ski pole when he fell going downhill. He immediately developed pain in the right thumb. He was seen at the mountainside and diagnosed to have a sprain. He presented to your office a week later because of ongoing pain and swelling in the thumb. Examination revealed a swollen metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb, as well as swelling on the ulnar side of the metacarpophalangeal joint. The most likely diagnosis is?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Gamekeeper’s thumb It is an injury of the thumb leading to avulsion, rupture or damage of the ulnar collateral ligament. It is commonly seen in gamekeepers and also following a fall on an outstretched hand.

Highyeild:

This is a classic mechanism of injury, and although the description of a classic gamekeeper’s thumb is a chronic injury to the ulnar collateral complex of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb, in contemporary terms any injury to the ulnar collateral complex of the thumb metacarpophalangeal joint is classified as a gamekeeper’s thumb. The more contemporary name for this condition is a skier’s thumb, which implies an acute injury to the ulnar collateral complex of the thumb metacarpophalangeal joint.

questions.text: All the following regarding hanging cast are correct except?

options.label: A
options.text: Usually used to treat fractures lower third of the humerus

options.label: B
options.text: The weight of the limb in the cast is supposed to provide the necessary traction to keep the fracture aligned

options.label: C
options.text: The cast is kept on for a period of 6-8 weeks

questions.correct_answer: D. Does not cause elbow stiffness
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Does not cause elbow stiffness Treatment by hanging cast is an old technique for the treatment of fractures humerus lower end with a reasonable rate of success. Elbow stiffness due to prolonged immobilization is a problem which is overcome by physiotherapy.

Highyeild:

This type of cast is used for angulated or displaced midshaft humerus fractures. The weight of the cast and forces achieved through adjustment of the length of the sling and site of attachment of the sling to the cast at the wrist can help achieve acceptable reduction and healing of the fracture.
